reviewTitle: Real VFM. Miss are overpowering with lesser highs.
reviewDescription: This product provides excellent value for money over all.However, strictly speaking from an audiophile perspective keep the following in mind.- highs (symbals and hiss sounds) are weak and that's mainly because the entire audio spectrum is handled by just 2 speakers and they struggle to produce anything above 4k Hz. This could have been improved with a couple of small tweeters (cost would increase though).- excellent bass radiotors. They have weights added to them if you remove and see. Which means zebronics have done their homework with calculations trying to reach as low frequency as possible from these speakers.- loudness is satisfying when placed inside the room or house. If you want to use it for a small gathering above 15 people outdoors, you would want something bigger.- lows are satisfying for the size and money point of view. Frequencies above 2k is slightly muddy but manageable.Construction- Looks and feels solid in hand and it can take a couple of drops from the hand.- I wouldn't let any droplets of water or liquid fall on to it. The cone (speaker memberne) is made of paper and can damage it although manufacturer gives it an IP rating. Note that there is nothing wrong with paper cone speaker. Infact pureist audiophiles love paper cone material.- RGB lights are mediocre and premitive. They might as well have removed it. Just blinks randomly.- Bluetooth range is pretty good with a good 70 feet free air distance.- Haven't tested battery.Overall thoughtsIt would have been perfect if those high notes were taken care of with dedicated tweeters. Even a cheap tweeters would have done the job. However, whole of India is behind 'waah Bhai kya bass hai' mindset and manufacturer took a very good cost cutting note from it. Being said all that it's still a very solid value for money product and I'm happy with my purchase.If money is not an issue there are better ones out there for sure. But I'm poor you see üòÇüòÖ
Only 1 hours battery backupVery bad battery backupBut quality good voice average

I have used sound systems from Panasonic, JBL, Skullcandy and I have to admit that Zebronics is giving tough competition to these brands and doing better than these.Sound is perfect combination of bass n trable.     ¬†Really loud on sound with 35+35rms.The bass is mostly clear only above 60, 70+ volume only.Although all the music isnt that crystal clear as marshal or JBL , it does the job for the offered price , got for disc of 3500 on prime day same where it's 1000rs higher regular price.It does offer around 9to10hrs backup at 50% volume , checked for week .And provide around 3 to 4 hours at Max volume. Where other brand are quite costlier for the output given.I was thinking to buy a 40w boat speaker but suddenly , in my childhood all we had were zebronics,iBall,creative speakers.. why not try it.Kind of worth it*Do not expect high range audio*It does it job.Also the sound clarity depends on quality buffered while streaming.Weighs 2.6*** kg , not quite handy to carry around.The box does not include any strap to hook it up even though there is a provision for hooks.

reviewTitle: Must buy if you're looking for a budget friendly speaker.
reviewDescription: The features are exactly as mentioned. Its deep-bass is amazingly effect (it also depends on the song) in a moderate to large sized room. Satisfied with the battery backup and volume even after having it for almost an year. Never felt the need to play it above 60% volume.

It is not a highly designed product but it does the job. Portable, good looking and decent music system. If you are looking perfect audio quality don't buy this but if you are looking for affordable portable speaker than its really good.

reviewTitle: Best Bluetooth speaker || ZEB SOUND FEAST 500
reviewDescription: It has incredible bass and incredibly clear sound quality in this price range of Rs 2795/-. The design and build quality catches your attention at first sight Used it outdoors and the results were pretty obvious...yes I'm a real beast.

Writing straight pros and consCONS = speaker is not much powerful as watt which is 70 watt mentioned . Sound is just ok when it's played above 70-80% volume . Below 70 % volume it voice get sudden dip then you can feel it's voice is low in comparison of mobile phone . Second thing Amazon delivered it with teared box with aux and charging cable is missing and they did nothing . Battery mention is fake cause you never ever play it below 50% volume so it will never going to give 9 hr battery life . Sound is just average bass is also below average which is major drawback of itCONS = portable in size , RGB lighting  enhance looks , gets easily connected, mic is just ok ok
This is just good speaker, but ok in this price
